conclusion: Four identical wooden blocks: A, B, C, D. Blocks B and C are connected by a light spring. Horizontal pulling force F is applied to block B. All blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration.

premise: The blocks are identical, and the total mass of the system is 4m. The net force causing the acceleration is F.
conclusion: The total mass of the system is 4m.

premise: The net force causing the acceleration is F.
conclusion: For the entire system (blocks A, B, C, and D): F = 4ma
Solving for acceleration a: a = F/(4m)

premise: Block D is part of the system and will have the same acceleration a.
conclusion: The force needed to accelerate block D is ma.

premise: Block D is in contact with block C, and the force needed to accelerate D must be provided by the static friction between D and C.
conclusion: The static friction force f acting on block D is given by: f = ma

premise: Using the value of a from F = 4ma: a = F/(4m)
